race.name: Rust Buster Gravel Fondo
race.tagline: Faulkner-country delta gravel and spring floods through Memphis, Tennessee backroads.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Tennessee delta. Light elevation with delta scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional TN event. Delta terrain with small-medium local field and light elevation.

biased_opinion.summary: Rust Buster Gravel Fondo is a regional event in Tennessee—delta terrain with light elevation. The delta scenery is pleasant, but the small-medium local field, regional organization, and limited prestige keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional TN gravel race. Worth it for TN/Southeast riders. Not worth traveling far for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to TN/Southeast—yes, it's solid. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better TN races: Reliance Tennessee Gravel, Gravel Revival.

logistics.food: Memphis has excellent dining. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: Tennessee spring can be hot and humid.

topics.heat: Riding in Tennessee heat and humidity

logistics.explanation: Clark Butcher at Victory Bicycle Studio handles organization from midtown Memphis, with Padraig noting the shop's community-building focus. The 2025 edition was canceled on BikeReg, indicating organizational challenges for this newer event.

length.explanation: The advertised 45-mile route actually measured closer to 52 miles according to riders. Padraig calls this "a really terrific distance for a gravel event" that lets you "get home at a reasonable hour" without burning a whole vacation day. More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: Padraig describes encountering "100-meter-long hills that tilt at 13 percent" in the Meeman-Shelby Forest State Park bluff land. The gravel sections feature "loose pea gravel but almost always two good lines." Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: While Western Tennessee is "mostly flat to slightly rolling," the river bluff terrain around Shelby Forest gets "very hilly." Padraig notes "none of the hills are particularly big" despite some steep pitches. Flatter profile than Croatan Buck Fifty.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 71°F and lows of 52°F, with a 49% chance of rain on any given day. Early April timing coincided with the solar eclipse, drawing visitors like Padraig to Memphis. The spring date avoids the "oppressive summers" that Padraig describes as characteristic of this William Faulkner South landscape. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: The course explores flat farmland "sometimes in sight of the Mississippi River" with terrain west of Tennessee's westernmost highway. Memphis river town elevation presents zero altitude considerations. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The route ventures into areas Padraig "never visited at all before" - flat farmland of "tilled fields, spring floods" that he describes as "William Faulkner's South." The 901 motocross club leads the gravel portion.

prestige.explanation: Victory Bicycle Studio launched this new event around 2024, with Clark Butcher "actively building community in Memphis." The 2025 cancellation and startup status limit established reputation in the gravel scene.

race_quality.explanation: Clark's tire recommendation to Padraig shows attention to course conditions. The route design avoids taking riders "back over all the hills in Shelby Forest," showing thoughtful planning for rider experience.

experience.explanation: The opening 20 miles run mostly paved before transitioning to "mostly gravel for the next 25 miles." Padraig met "a number of really nice riders" and connected with podcast listeners during the event.

community.explanation: Post-race featured "lamb tacos, chicken wings, a local IPA and small servings of key lime pie." The event draws riders from Arkansas, Georgia, North Carolina, and Mississippi to Memphis.

field_depth.explanation: With a field of 75-125 riders, the startup event attracts recreational riders rather than competitive depth. Strava segments with KOM/QOM awards suggest fitness-focused participation without serious racing fields or pro involvement. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Elevated post-race food including lamb tacos and key lime pie beats standard "fig newton and warm Gatorade." The 50-mile distance with quality hospitality and Memphis pricing delivers solid value.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $65-85. Memphis offers affordable lodging and dining compared to destination gravel markets. Padraig flew in for the eclipse, suggesting reasonable travel access, while local pricing keeps overall event costs manageable. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

citations.label: cyclingindependent.com: The Rust Bucket Gravel Ride

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
